# NOTE: For details on dynamic UIs in Maya, please refer to AEcgfxShaderTemplate.mel

import pymel.core
import pymel.core.general
import pymel.core.system
import oslparser
import os.path

def openShader(shader):
        if len(shader) == 0:
                return
        with open(shader) as file:
                parser = oslparser.OslParser(file)
                parser.parse()
                return parser.params

def destroyShaderParamAttrs(node):
        nodeAttrs = pymel.core.general.listAttr(node)
        for attr in nodeAttrs:  
                if attr[-5:] == "Float":
                        node.deleteAttr(attr)
                if attr[-8:] == "ColorRGB":
                        node.deleteAttr(attr)
                if attr[-7:] == "Texture":
                        node.deleteAttr(attr)
                if attr[-3:] == "Int":
                        node.deleteAttr(attr)

def createShaderParamAttrs(nodeName, params):
        node = pymel.core.general.PyNode(nodeName)
        destroyShaderParamAttrs(node)
        for (key, value, defaultVal) in params:
                if value == "float":
                        attrName = key + "Float"
                        node.addAttr(attrName, attributeType='float', min = 0.0, max = 100000.0, smn = 0.0, smx = 1.0)
                        node.setAttr(attrName, defaultVal)
                if value == "color":
                        attrName = key + "ColorRGB"
                        node.addAttr(attrName, attributeType='float3', usedAsColor=True)
                        node.addAttr(attrName[:-3] + "R", attributeType='float', parent=attrName)
                        node.addAttr(attrName[:-3] + "G", attributeType='float', parent=attrName)
                        node.addAttr(attrName[:-3] + "B", attributeType='float', parent=attrName)
                        node.setAttr(attrName, defaultVal)
                if value == "string":
                        attrName = key + "Texture"
                        node.addAttr(attrName, attributeType='float3', usedAsColor=True)
                        node.addAttr(attrName + "R", attributeType='float', parent=attrName)
                        node.addAttr(attrName + "G", attributeType='float', parent=attrName)
                        node.addAttr(attrName + "B", attributeType='float', parent=attrName)
                if value == "int":
                        attrName = key + "Int"
                        node.addAttr(attrName, attributeType='long', min = 0, max = 100000, smn = 0, smx = 1)
                        node.setAttr(attrName, defaultVal)
        pymel.core.general.evalDeferred("pymel.core.mel.autoUpdateAttrEd()")

class AEbeastOSLShaderTemplate(pymel.core.ui.AETemplate):
        def __init__(self, nodeName):
                self.resetShader = []
                self.beginScrollLayout()
                self.beginLayout("Shader", collapse = 0)
                self.callCustom(self.createShaderFileSelector, self.createShaderFileSelector, "shader")
                self.endLayout()
                self.callCustom(self.createShaderParams, self.createShaderParams, "params")
                nodeAttrs = pymel.core.general.listAttr(nodeName)
                for attrs in nodeAttrs:
                        self.suppress(attrs)
                self.addExtraControls()
                self.callCustom(self.onSuppressExtraControlsNew, self.onSuppressExtraControlsReplace, "extras")
                self.endScrollLayout()
                
        def onSuppressExtraControlsNew(self, attrStr):
                extrasParent = pymel.core.windows.setParent("..")
                children = pymel.core.windows.layout(extrasParent, query=True, childArray=True)
                extrasLabel = pymel.core.mel.uiRes("s_TPStemplateStrings.rExtraAttributes")
                for child in children:
                        isFrameLayout = pymel.core.windows.objectTypeUI(child, isType="frameLayout")
                        if isFrameLayout:
                                childLabel = pymel.core.windows.frameLayout(child, query=True, label=True)
                                if childLabel == extrasLabel:
                                        pymel.core.windows.frameLayout(child, edit=True, manage=0)

        def onSuppressExtraControlsReplace(self, node):
                return

        def createShaderFileSelector(self, attrStr):
                attr = pymel.core.general.Attribute(attrStr)
                node = attr.node()
                if hasattr(self, "shaderCtrl"):
                        pymel.core.windows.deleteUI(self.shaderCtrl)
                self.shaderCtrl = pymel.core.windows.textFieldButtonGrp(label="Shader File", buttonLabel="Browse", text=node.shader.get(), editable=False, buttonCommand=pymel.core.windows.Callback(self.onPressShaderSelect, node))

        def onPressShaderSelect(self, node):
                filter = "OSL Shader Files (*.osl)"
                templateDirectory = pymel.core.melGlobals['gBeastRoot'] + "/examples-physical/data"
                shaderFile = pymel.core.system.fileDialog2(startingDirectory=templateDirectory, caption="Select OSL shader file", fileFilter=filter, dialogStyle=2, fileMode=1)
                if shaderFile and len(shaderFile) > 0:
                        # Strip project directory
                        projectPath = pymel.core.system.Workspace.getPath()
                        absShaderPath = shaderFile[0]
                        relShaderPath = absShaderPath
                        try:
                                relShaderPath = os.path.relpath(relShaderPath, projectPath)
                        except:
                                pass
                        node.shader.set(relShaderPath)
                        self.shaderCtrl.setText(relShaderPath)
                        if node not in self.resetShader:
                                self.resetShader.append(node)
                        pymel.core.general.evalDeferred("import AEbeastOSLShaderTemplate\nAEbeastOSLShaderTemplate.createShaderParamAttrs('" + node + "', AEbeastOSLShaderTemplate.openShader('" + absShaderPath + "'))")

        def createShaderParams(self, attrStr):
                node = pymel.core.general.PyNode(attrStr.split(".")[0])
                self.createShaderParamsCtrls(node)

        def createShaderParamsCtrls(self, node):
                self.paramCtrls = []
                if hasattr(self, "paramsLayout"):
                        pymel.core.windows.deleteUI(self.paramsLayout)
                        delattr(self, "paramsLayout")
                if node.name() in self.resetShader:
                        self.resetShader.remove(node.name())
                        return
                pymel.core.windows.setUITemplate("attributeEditorTemplate", pushTemplate=True)
                self.paramsLayout = pymel.core.windows.frameLayout(label="Shader Parameters", collapse=0)
                self.columnLayout = pymel.core.windows.columnLayout(adjustableColumn=True, visible=True)
                nodeAttrs = pymel.core.general.listAttr(node)
                for attr in nodeAttrs:
                        if attr[-5:] == "Float":
                                self.paramCtrls.append(pymel.core.windows.attrFieldSliderGrp(attribute="%s.%s" % (node, attr), label=attr[:-5], hideMapButton=True))
                        if attr[-8:] == "ColorRGB":
                                self.paramCtrls.append(pymel.core.windows.attrColorSliderGrp(attribute="%s.%s" % (node, attr), label=attr[:-8], showButton=False))
                        if attr[-7:] == "Texture":
                                self.paramCtrls.append(pymel.core.windows.attrColorSliderGrp(attribute="%s.%s" % (node, attr), label=attr[:-7], showButton=True))
                        if attr[-3:] == "Int":
                                self.paramCtrls.append(pymel.core.windows.attrFieldSliderGrp(attribute="%s.%s" % (node, attr), label=attr[:-3]))
                pymel.core.windows.setParent("..")
                pymel.core.windows.setUITemplate(popTemplate=True)
